net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.complex

Class UiWidgetCustomAbstractListTable<ROW,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.UiWidgetCustom<List<ROW>,DELEGATE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.complex.UiWidgetCustomAbstractListTable<ROW,DELEGATE>
  • Type Parameters:
    ROW - is the generic type of a row in the value list.
    DELEGATE - is the generic type of the delegate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>, UiFeatureValidation<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValue<List<ROW>>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<List<ROW>>, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<List<ROW>>, UiWidgetListBase<ROW>, UiWidgetListContainer<ROW>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ROW>, UiWidgetWithValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<List<ROW>>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteValue<List<ROW>>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<List<ROW>>, ValidatableObject<List<ROW>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetCustomListTable

    public abstract class UiWidgetCustomAbstractListTable<ROW,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>>
extends UiWidgetCustom<List<ROW>,DELEGATE>
implements UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
    This is the abstract base class for a custom widget implementing UiWidgetAbstractListTable.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • createColumn

        public <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(TypedProperty<CELL> rowProperty,
                                                         UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                         Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Specified by:
        createColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property type.
        Parameters:
        rowProperty - is the TypedProperty identifying which property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • createColumn

        public <CELL> UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL> createColumn(PropertyAccessor<ROW,CELL> rowAccessor,
                                                         UiSingleWidgetFactory<? extends UiWidgetWithValue<CELL>> widgetFactory,
                                                         Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method creates a new column for this table.
        ATTENTION:
        The column is not automatically added to the table. You need to call UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.setColumns(List) for all columns that should appear in the UI.
        Specified by:
        createColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Type Parameters:
        CELL - is the generic type of the property value.
        Parameters:
        rowAccessor - is the PropertyAccessor to access the property of <ROW> to show in the column.
        widgetFactory - is the factory to create widgets for this column. ATTENTION: These widgets might be reused for performance-reasons for a different row just by setting its value. They should NOT contain additional state information (what is generally a bad idea). This parameter may be null to fall back to datatype based creation.
        sortComparator - is the sort-comparator to set.
        Returns:
        a new UiWidgetTableColumn.

      • setColumns

        public void setColumns(List<? extends UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,?>> columns)
        This method sets the columns for the table of this model.
        You typically will call this method like this: 
        list.setColumns(Arrays.asList(column1, column2, column3))
        Unfortunately varargs with generics cause trouble in interfaces.
        ATTENTION:
        This method should typically be called only once during initialization of this table. Multiple calls of this method for dynamic changes of the UI may NOT be completely supported by all underlying implementations. We recommend to test your code with all relevant implementations before investing in multiple dynamic changes. Consider AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced.setVisible(boolean) instead if possible.
        Specified by:
        setColumns in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        columns - are the columns to set. Use createColumn to create before.
        See Also:
        UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.createColumn(TypedProperty, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator), UiWidgetAbstractDataTable.createColumn(PropertyAccessor, UiSingleWidgetFactory, Comparator)

        the requested column.

        ATTENTION:
        This is available for advanced flexibility. Please avoid changing title, reorderable, resizable, or sortable.
        This column may be lazily created. Only use if you want to make it visible.
        Specified by:
        getRowNumberColumn in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>

        Specified by:
        getColumnById in interface UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>
        Parameters:

        required - - if true and the requested column does not exist, an exception is thrown, false otherwise (null will be returned for non existent columns).
        Returns:
        the requested column or null if no such column exists and required is false.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if no column exists with the given columnId and required is true.

      • setSelection

        public boolean setSelection(SelectionChoice choice,
                            SelectionOperation operation)
        This method allows to change the selection of a logical SelectionChoice in a generic way. The following table shows the combinations and their effect:
        choice operation setSelection(choice, operation) multi selection only
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.SET selects all items. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.ADD same effect as above. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.REMOVE de-selects all items so none is selected. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.TOGGLE toggles the selection of all items so the selection gets inverted. yes
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.SET clears the selection and then selects the first item. no
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.ADD Adds the first item to the current selection. yes
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.REMOVE Removes the first item from the current selection. no
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.TOGGLE Toggles the selection of the first item. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.SET clears the selection and then selects the last item. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.ADD Adds the last item to the current selection. yes
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.REMOVE Removes the last item from the current selection. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.TOGGLE Toggles the selection of the last item. no
        Specified by:
        setSelection in interface UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>
        Parameters:
        choice - is the SelectionChoice indicating the items to select or deselect.
        operation - is the SelectionOperation indicating what to do with the choice.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise. If there are no items at all true is returned in case of SelectionChoice.ALL and false otherwise.

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(SelectionChoice choice)
        This method determines if the given logical SelectionChoice is currently selected.
        Specified by:
        isSelected in interface UiFeatureSelectedValue<ROW>
        Parameters:
        choice - is the SelectionChoice to check.
        Returns:
        true if the items identified by the given choice are currently selected, false otherwise (if at least one of them is NOT selected).

      • setSelectedValue

        public boolean setSelectedValue(ROW selectedValue)
        This method sets the value currently selected. If the given value is NOT available, the method will have NO effect. Otherwise this method will deselect all currently selected values and select the given value.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedValue in interface AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>
        Parameters:
        selectedValue - is the value to select.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise (the given selectedValue is not contained in this object and cannot be selected).

      • setSelectedValues

        public boolean setSelectedValues(Collection<ROW> selectedValues)
        This method sets the values currently selected. All values that are NOT available, will be ignored.
        ATTENTION:
        In case of SelectionMode.SINGLE_SELECTION you shall not provide a Collection with more than one element. So you should then use AttributeWriteSelectedValue.setSelectedValue(Object) instead.
        Further, if you call AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValues() after this method the items may be in a different order. Additionally the result of AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValue() will contain elements that are actually items available in this object. So e.g. if you have a list of items and call this method to select two items but only one of them is actually available in the list, then only that one is selected and therefore returned by AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValues().
        Specified by:
        setSelectedValues in interface AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ROW>
        Parameters:
        selectedValues - is the Collection with the values to select.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful and all selectedValues have been selected, false otherwise (at least one item out of selectedValues is not contained in this object and cannot be selected).

      • hasSelectedValue

        public boolean hasSelectedValue()
        Specified by:
        hasSelectedValue in interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>
        Returns:
        true if at least one value is selected, false otherwise.

      • getSelectedValue

        public ROW getSelectedValue()
        This method gets the currently selected value (item).
        Specified by:
        getSelectedValue in interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>
        Returns:
        the selected value or null if no value is selected.

      • getSelectedValues

        public Collection<ROW> getSelectedValues()
        This method gets the currently selected values. The order of the returned Collection is unspecified.
        Specified by:
        getSelectedValues in interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>
        Returns:
        the Collection with all selected values. Will be empty if nothing is selected.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValue()

      • getSelectionCount

        public int getSelectionCount()
        Logically the same as AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValues().size() but more efficient.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionCount in interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<ROW>
        Returns:
        the number of selected values.

      • setSelectionMode

        public void setSelectionMode(SelectionMode selectionMode)
        This method sets the selection mode.
        ATTENTION:
        It is recommended to set the SelectionMode immediately after creating the object. The initial default is always SelectionMode.SINGLE_SELECTION. Dynamically changing the SelectionMode may be expensive or not be supported (in exotic implementations) and should therefore be avoided.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionMode in interface AttributeWriteSelectionMode
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - is the new SelectionMode.

      • getSelectionMode

        public SelectionMode getSelectionMode()
        This method gets the SelectionMode.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionMode in interface AttributeReadSelectionMode
        Returns:
        the SelectionMode. Must not be null.

      • getSummary

        public String getSummary()
        This method gets the summary of this object. It describes the main purpose of this object in a short and compact way. A summary might not be visible but is honored by assistive technology such as screen-readers.
        Specified by:
        getSummary in interface AttributeReadSummary
        Returns:
        the text. Will be the empty string if no text has been set.

      • setTitleVisible

        public void setTitleVisible(boolean titleVisible)
        This method sets the titleVisible flag of this object.
        Specified by:
        setTitleVisible in interface AttributeWriteTitleVisible
        Parameters:
        titleVisible - is the new value for AttributeReadTitleVisible.isTitleVisible().

      • isTitleVisible

        public boolean isTitleVisible()
        This method determines if the title of this object is visible. For Accessibility reasons you should always set the title of a titled object. However in specific cases you want to save space on the screen and may not require the title to be displayed for seeing users. Then you can hide the title while it is still recognized by assistive technology such as screen readers.
        Specified by:
        isTitleVisible in interface AttributeReadTitleVisible
        Returns:
        true if visible, false if hidden.

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(boolean editableFlag)
        This method set the editable status.
        Specified by:
        setEditable in interface AttributeWriteEditable
        Parameters:
        editableFlag - if true the object will become editable, if false the object will become un-editable.

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        This method gets the editable status of this object. Editable means that the end-user can edit the data of the object if also in edit mode (e.g. a data table that allows inline editing). If the editable feature is turned off, the user can no longer edit the data.
        This is closely related to AttributeReadEnabled.isEnabled(). However turning off the editable-flag is weaker than disabling a UI object. An enabled but NOT editable object may still allow user-interaction (e.g. a combobox that still allows selection out of a predefined list but no editing of the text). Further the visualization is softer (no grey out of the entire object).
        ATTENTION:
        There may be other aspects that have influence if the user can currently edit this object such as the mode or enabled flag. This method only returns the editable flag (as set via AttributeWriteEditable.setEditable(boolean)) and therefore only tells if the object is potentially editable.
        Specified by:
        isEditable in interface AttributeReadEditable
        Returns:
        true if this object is editable, false otherwise.

      • getRowIndex

        public int getRowIndex(ROW row)
        Gets the index of the given row.
        ATTENTION:
        The index of a row is not stable and may change at any time due to sorting or other features. You should only retrieve an index to immediately use it e.g. for UiWidgetAbstractListTable.addRow(Object, int) to insert a row before or after a given row such as the selected row. Please avoid storing such index and use it later as this can cause fatal bugs.
        Specified by:
        getRowIndex in interface UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        row - is the <ROW> to locate.
        Returns:
        the index of the given row or -1 if not found.
        See Also:
        List.indexOf(Object)

      • addRow

        public void addRow(ROW row)
        Adds the given row at the end of this list table.
        Specified by:
        addRow in interface UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        row - is the <ROW> to add.
        See Also:
        UiWidgetAbstractListTable.addRow(Object, int)

      • addRow

        public void addRow(ROW row,
                   int index)
        Adds the given row to this list table.
        ATTENTION:
        Be careful when dealing with indices. The index of a row can change at any time due to sorting or other features. You may use this method in combination of recent calls to UiWidgetAbstractListTable.getRowIndex(Object).
        Specified by:
        addRow in interface UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        row - is the <ROW> to add.
        index - is the index where to add the given row.

      • replaceRow

        public boolean replaceRow(ROW oldRow,
                          ROW newRow)
        This method replaces a <ROW> in this list table.
        Specified by:
        replaceRow in interface UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        oldRow - is the old <ROW> to replace.
        newRow - is the new <ROW> to insert in place of the old one.
        Returns:
        true if oldRow was found and replaced, false otherwise (if this list table does not contain oldRow and nothing was changed).

      • removeRow

        public boolean removeRow(ROW row)
        This method removes the given row.
        Specified by:
        removeRow in interface UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>
        Parameters:
        row - is the <ROW> to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the row was found and removed, false otherwise (if this list table does not contain oldRow and nothing was changed).
